  2. Meru tower: the principal shrine of a Balinese temple, a wooden, pagoda-like structure with a masonry base, a wooden chamber and multi-tiered thatched roofs.
  3. triangular decoration as a symbol of the divine being.

  1. water

noun
  1. smoke (visible particles and vapour given off by burning material)
  2. incense

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /i/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᬶ is read as "ni").

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /u/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᬸ is read as "nu").

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /ɛ ~ e/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᬾ is read as "né").

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /aj/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᬿ is read as "nai").

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /o/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᭀ is read as "no").

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /aw/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᭁ is read as "nau").

character
  1. Changes the vowel value of a consonant to a schwa (/ə/) (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᭂ is read as "ne").

character
  1. A letter of the Balinese script. Bearing the name adeg-adeg, it is used on a consonant to suppress the inherent vowel /a/ or /ə/ (i.e. while ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦ᭄ is read as "n"). Thus, it's the Balinese script's version of the virama found in other Brahmic scripts.

symbol
  1. Written in the middle of a sentence, like a comma; also written between numerals to differentiate them from the main text.

symbol
  1. Written at the end of a sentence; acts like a full stop/period (.).
